conclusion: Need to analyze the given U-I graphs for both the photocell and the resistor to determine the internal resistance of the silicon photocell.
The intersection point of lines a and b represents the operating point when the photocell and the resistor are connected in a closed loop.
The intersection point is at I = 0.2 A and U = 2.5 V.
Line b represents the U-I relationship of the resistor R.
The slope of line b can be calculated using two points on the line.
Using the origin (0, 0) and another point on the line, such as (0.4, 5).
The slope mb of line b is calculated as 12.5 Ω.
Line a represents the U-I relationship of the photocell.
The slope of line a at the intersection point gives the internal resistance r of the photocell at that operating point.
Approximate the slope by considering small changes around the intersection point.
The slope ma of line a is calculated as -25 Ω.
The negative sign indicates the direction of the slope, but the magnitude gives the internal resistance r.
The internal resistance r of the photocell is the absolute value of the slope of line a at the intersection point, which is 25 Ω.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell when it is connected in a closed loop with the resistor R at this light intensity is 25 Ω.
